content: Investments Stocks Securities Equities Asked by AnonymousAsked on 29 Apr 2019What is considered safe returns?We all want a high ROI, but what exactly is a good benchmark for a high yet safe ROI?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 29 Apr 2019When your capital is guaranteed. Then that's safe. You won't lose any money.Any instrument that is not guaranteed will have some risk. Very low to very high risk. So instead of thinking about 'safe', think about how much risk are you willing to take. Usually, high risk high reward (but not all the time).0 comments0
